title: Carney defends Facebook's Libra in call for digital payments revolution
text:
Mark Carney has leapt to the defence of Facebook’s digital currency as he warned that the UK’s "slow and expensive" payments system is “not good enough in this day and age”.

Just days after credit card giants Visa and Mastercard pulled out of the Libra project, the Bank of England Governor laid out the case for a revolution in online payments - while insisting that Facebook must meet the same stringent standards as other finance firms if it wants to go ahead.

Mr Carney said Britain needs to face up to its payment problems and bring its system “up to a standard that is found in a number of major emerging economies and a few advanced economies."
